title.narrative: 001.ENABLING ENVRIONMENT FOR SUN

description.narrative: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan and budget for scaling-up nutrition interventions for women of reproductive age and children under 5 ., which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Malnutrition is prevented and treated among women of reproductive age and children under 5 through increased access to sustainable, quality integrated nutrition interventions

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan and budget for scaling-up nutritioninterventions for women of reproductive age and children under 5 .

description.narrative: Persistent efforts by UNICEF and its partners throughout the country programme have translated into a positive, visible enabling environment for nutrition. Key features include high level multi-sector coordination, favorable legislation reforms and enforcement mechanisms, increased fiscal budgets and stronger coherence for nutrition among the UN and SUN multi-stakeholders | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/12/2017

title.narrative: A multi-sectoral and costed Scaling Up Nutrition (SUN) operational plan is in place that includes clear targets especially for the most vulnerable groups. Scale: 0 (not established), 1 (draft plan exists), 2 (draft plan is costed), 3 (plan is reviewed by the Government , 4 (plan is finalised and costed)

actual.value: 2017:3 - plan is reviewed by the Government

title.narrative: Disaster risk management and emergency preparedness is integrated in relevant nutrition sector plans or policies. Scale: 0 (no existence), 1 (draft plan/strategy includes), 2 (finalised plan/strategy includes), 3 (Government endorsed plan includes)
Adoption of the International Code on Marketing of Breastmilk substitutes as legislation and subsequent relevant World Health Assembly resolutions
